summary:
Cookies are small data packets that websites store on your computer when you browse the internet. They help websites remember things about you, like items in your shopping cart or your login details. This makes your online experience smoother.

There are different types of cookies. Some help with security, like proving you're logged in. Others track your activity, which can be a privacy concern. Because of this, laws in Europe and the US now require websites to ask for your permission before storing certain cookies.
title: HTTP cookie
